00001 
00002 #  this module holds the graph.  Several functions
00003 #  and labels may be plotted on
00004 #  the graph.
00005 
00006 # constructor   new WWPlot(300,400) constructs an image of width 300 by height 400 pixels
00007 # plot->imageName gives the image's name
00008 
00009 
00010 =head1 NAME
00011 
00012     WWPlot
00013 
00014 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00015 
00016  
00017     $graph = new WWPlot(400,400); # creates a graph 400 pixels by 400 pixels
00018     $graph->fn($fun1, $fun2);     # installs functions $fun1 and $fun2 in $graph
00019     $image_binary = $graph->draw();  # creates the gif/png image of the functions installed in the graph
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This module creates a graph object -- a canvas on which to draw functions, labels, and other symbols.
00024 The graph can be drawn with an axis, with a grid, and/or with an axis with tick marks.
00025 The position of the axes and the granularity of the grid and tick marks can be specified.
00026 
00027 =head2 new
00028 
00029     $graph = new WWPlot(400,400);
00030 
00031 Creates a graph object 400 pixels by 400 pixels.  The size is required.
00032 
00033 
00034 
00035 
00036 =head2 Methods and properties
00037 
00038 =over 4
00039 
00040 =item xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax
00041 
00042 These determine the world co-ordinates of the graph. The constructions
00043 
00044     $new_xmin = $graph->xmin($new_xmin);
00045 and
00046     $current_xmin = $graph->xmin();
00047 
00048 set and read the values.
00049 
00050 =item fn, lb, stamps
00051 
00052 These arrays contain references to the functions (fn), the labels (lb) and the stamped images (stamps) such
00053 as open or closed circles which will drawn when the graph is asked to draw itself. Since each of these
00054 objects is expected to draw itself, there is not a strong difference between the different arrays of objects.
00055 The principle difference is the order in which they are drawn.  The axis and grids are drawn first, followed
00056 by the functions, then the labels, then the stamps.
00057 
00058 You can add a function with either of the commands
00059 
00060     @fn = $graph->fn($new_fun_ref1, $new_fun_ref2);
00061     @fn = $graph->install($new_fun_ref1, $new_fun_ref2);
00062 
00063 the constructions for labels and stamps are respectively:
00064 
00065     @labels = $graph->lb($new_label);
00066     @stamps = $graph->stamps($new_stamp);
00067 
00068 while
00069 
00070     @functions = $graph->fn();
00071 
00072 will give a list of the current functions (similary for labels and stamps).
00073 
00074 Either of the  commands
00075 
00076     $graph->fn('reset');
00077     $graph->fn('erase');
00078 
00079 will erase the array containing the functions and similary for the label and stamps arrays.
00080 
00081 
00082 =item h_axis, v_axis
00083 
00084     $h_axis_coordinate = $graph -> h_axis();
00085     $new_axis    =       $grpah -> h_axis($new_axis);
00086 
00087 Respectively read and set the vertical coordinate value in real world coordinates where the
00088 horizontal axis intersects the vertical one.  The same construction reads and sets the coordinate
00089 value for the vertical axis. The axis is drawn more darkly than the grids.
00090 
00091 =item h_ticks, v_ticks
00092 
00093     @h_ticks = $graph -> h_ticks();
00094     @h_ticks = $graph -> h_ticks( $tick1, $tick2, $tick3, $tick4   );
00095 
00096 reads and sets the coordinates for the tick marks along the horizontal axis.  The values
00097 $tick1, etc are the real world coordinate values for each of the tick marks.
00098 
00099 =item h_grid, v_grid
00100 
00101     @h_grid = $graph -> h_grid();
00102     @h_grid = $graph -> h_grid( $grid1, $grid2, $grid3, $grid4   );
00103 
00104 reads and sets the verical coordinates for the horizontal grid lines.  The values
00105 $grid1, etc are the real world coordinate values where the horizontal grid meets the
00106 vertical axis.
00107 
00108 =item draw
00109 
00110     $image = $graph ->draw();
00111 
00112 Draws the  image of the graph.
00113 
00114 =item size
00115 
00116     ($horizontal_pixels, $vertical_pixels)  = @{$graph ->size()};
00117 
00118 Reads the size of the graph image in pixels.  This cannot be reset. It is defined by
00119 the new constructor and cannot be changed. 
00120 
00121 =item colors
00122 
00123     %colors =$graph->colors();
00124 
00125 Returns the hash containing the colors known to the graph.  The keys are the names of the
00126 colors and the values are the color indices used by the graph.
00127 
00128 =item new_color
00129 
00130     $graph->new_color('white', 255,255,255);
00131 
00132 defines a new color named white with red, green and blue densities 255.
00133 
00134 =item im
00135 
00136     $GD_image = $graph->im();
00137 
00138 Allows access to the GD image object contained in the graph object.  You can use this
00139 to access methods defined in GD but not supported directly by WWPlot. (See the documentation
00140 for GD.)
00141 
00142 =item moveTo, lineTo, arrowTo
00143 
00144     $graph->moveTo($x,$y);
00145     $graph->lineTo($x,$y,$color);
00146     $graph->lineTo($x,$y,$color,$thickness);
00147     $graph->lineTo($x,$y,$color,$thickness,'dashed');
00148     $graph->arrowTo($x,$y,$color);
00149     $graph->arrowTo($x,$y,$color,$thickness);
00150     $graph->arrowTo($x,$y,$color,$thickness,'dashed');
00151 
00152 Moves to the point ($x, $y) (defined in real world coordinates) or draws a line or arrow
00153 from the current position to the specified point ($x, $y) using the color $color.  $color 
00154 is the name, e.g. 'white',  of the color, not an index value or RGB specification.  
00155 $thickness gives the thickness of the line or arrow to draw.  If 'dashed' is specified,
00156 the line or arrow is rendered with a dashed line.  These are low level call 
00157 back routines used by the function, label and stamp objects to draw themselves.
00158 
00159 =item ii, jj
00160 
00161 These functions translate from real world to pixel coordinates.
00162 
00163     $pixels_down_from_top = $graph -> jj($y);
00164 
00165 
00166 =back
00167 
00168 =cut
00169

00208 sub new {
00209     my $class =shift;
00210     my @size = @_;   # the dimensions in pixels of the image
00211     my $self = { im         =>  new GD::Image(@size),
00212                 %fields,
00213                 size        =>  [@size],
00214                 fn          =>  [],
00215                 fillRegion      =>      [],
00216                 lb          =>  [],
00217                 stamps      =>  [],
00218                 colors      =>  {},
00219                 hticks      =>  [],
00220                 vticks      =>  [],
00221                 hgrid       =>  [],
00222                 vgrid       =>  [],
00223                 haxis       =>  [],
00224                 vaxis       =>  [],
00225 
00226 
00227     };
00228 
00229     bless $self, $class;
00230     $self ->    _initialize;
00231     return $self;
00232 }

00234 # access methods for function list, label list and image
00235 sub fn {
00236     my $self =  shift;
00237 
00238     if (@_ == 0) {
00239         # do nothing if input is empty
00240     } elsif ($_[0] eq 'reset' or $_[0] eq 'erase' ) {
00241         $self->{fn} = [];
00242     } else {
00243         push(@{$self->{fn}},@_) if @_;
00244     }
00245     @{$self->{fn}};
00246 }
00247 # access methods for fillRegion list, label list and image

00251     if (@_ == 0) {
00252         # do nothing if input is empty
00253     } elsif ($_[0] eq 'reset' or $_[0] eq 'erase' ) {
00254         $self->{fillRegion} = [];
00255     } else {
00256         push(@{$self->{fillRegion}},@_) if @_;
00257     }
00258     @{$self->{fillRegion}};
00259 }

00317 sub _initialize {
00318     my $self            = shift;
00319         $self->{position}    = [0,0];
00320 #   $self->{width}      = $self->{'size'}[0];    # original height and width tags match pixel dimensions
00321 #   $self->{height}     = $self->{'size'}[1];    # of the image
00322     # allocate some colors
00323         $self->{'colors'}{'background_color'}   =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,255,255);
00324         $self->{'colors'}{'default_color'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,0,0);
00325         $self->{'colors'}{'white'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,255,255);
00326         $self->{'colors'}{'black'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,0,0);
00327         $self->{'colors'}{'red'}    =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,0,0);
00328         $self->{'colors'}{'green'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,255,0);
00329         $self->{'colors'}{'blue'}   =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,0,255);
00330         $self->{'colors'}{'yellow'} =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,255,0);
00331         $self->{'colors'}{'orange'} =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,100,0);
00332         $self->{'colors'}{'gray'}   =   $self->im->colorAllocate(180,180,180);
00333         $self->{'colors'}{'nearwhite'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(254,254,254);
00334    # obtain a new imageNumber;
00335        $self->{imageNumber} = ++$last_image_number;
00336 }

00342 #   The translation subroutines.

00344 sub ii {
00345     my $self = shift;
00346     my $x = shift;
00347     return undef unless defined($x);
00348     my $xmax = $self-> xmax ;
00349     my $xmin = $self-> xmin ;
00350     int( ($x - $xmin)*(@{$self->size}[0]) / ($xmax - $xmin) );
00351 }
00352 
00353 sub jj {
00354     my $self = shift;
00355     my $y = shift;
00356     return undef unless defined($y);
00357     my $ymax = $self->ymax;
00358     my $ymin = $self->ymin;
00359     #print "ymax=$ymax y=$y ymin=$ymin size=",${$self->size}[1],"<BR><BR><BR><BR>";
00360     int( ($ymax - $y)*${$self->size}[1]/($ymax-$ymin) );
00361 }
00362 
00363 #  The move and draw subroutines.  Arguments are in real world coordinates.
00364 
00365 sub lineTo {
00366     my $self = shift;
00367     my ($x,$y,$color, $w, $d) = @_;
00368     $w = 1 if ! defined( $w );
00369     $d = 0 if ! defined( $d );  ## draw a dashed line?
00370 
00371     $x=$self->ii($x);
00372     $y=$self->jj($y);
00373     $color = $self->{'colors'}{$color} if $color=~/[A-Za-z]+/ && defined($self->{'colors'}{$color}) ; # colors referenced by name works here.
00374     $color = $self->{'colors'}{'default_color'} unless defined($color);
00375 
00376     $self->im->setThickness( $w );
00377     if ( $d ) {
00378         my @dashing = ( $color )x(4*$w*$w);
00379         my @spacing = ( GD::gdTransparent )x(3*$w*$w);
00380         $self->im->setStyle( @dashing, @spacing );
00381         $self->im->line(@{$self->position},$x,$y,GD::gdStyled);
00382     } else {
00383         $self->im->line(@{$self->position},$x,$y,$color);
00384     }
00385     $self->im->setThickness( 1 );
00386      #warn "color is $color";
00387     @{$self->position} = ($x,$y);
00388 }
00389 
00390 sub moveTo {
00391     my $self = shift;
00392     my $x=shift;
00393     my $y=shift;
00394     $x=$self->ii($x);
00395     $y=$self->jj($y);
00396     #print "moving to $x,$y<BR>";
00397     @{$self->position} = ( $x,$y );
00398 }
00399 
00400 sub arrowTo {
00401     my $self = shift;
00402     my ( $x1, $y1, $color, $w, $d ) = @_;
00403     $w = 1 if ! defined( $w );
00404     $d = 0 if ! defined( $d );
00405     my $width = ( $w == 1 ) ? 2 : $w;
00406 
00407     $x1 = $self->ii($x1);
00408     $y1 = $self->jj($y1);
00409     $color = $self->{'colors'}{$color} if $color=~/[A-Za-z]+/ && defined($self->{'colors'}{$color}) ;
00410     $color = $self->{'colors'}{'default_color'} unless defined($color);
00411 
00412     ## set thickness
00413     $self->im->setThickness($w);
00414 
00415     my ($x0, $y0) = @{$self->position};
00416     my $dx = $x1 - $x0;
00417     my $dy = $y1 - $y0;
00418     my $len = sqrt($dx*$dx + $dy*$dy);
00419     my $ux = $dx/$len;  ## a unit vector in the direction of the arrow
00420     my $uy = $dy/$len;
00421     my $px = -1*$uy;    ## a unit vector perpendicular
00422     my $py = $ux;
00423     my $hbx = $x1 - 5*$width*$ux;  ## the base of the arrowhead
00424     my $hby = $y1 - 5*$width*$uy;
00425     my $head = new GD::Polygon;
00426     $head->addPt($x1,$y1);
00427     $head->addPt($hbx + 2*$width*$px, $hby + 2*$width*$py);
00428     $head->addPt($hbx - 2*$width*$px, $hby - 2*$width*$py);
00429     $self->im->filledPolygon( $head, $color );
00430     if ( $d ) {
00431         my @dashing = ( $color )x(4*$w*$w);
00432         my @spacing = ( GD::gdTransparent )x(3*$w*$w);
00433         $self->im->setStyle( @dashing, @spacing );
00434         $self->im->line( $x0,$y0,$x1,$y1,GD::gdStyled);
00435     } else {
00436         $self->im->line( $x0,$y0,$x1,$y1,$color );
00437     }
00438 
00439     @{$self->position} = ( $x1, $y1 );
00440 
00441     ## reset thickness
00442     $self->im->setThickness(1);
00443 }

00477 sub draw {
00478         my $self = shift;
00479         my $im =$self->{'im'};
00480         my @size = @{$self->size};
00481         my %colors =%{$self->colors};
00482 
00483 # make the background transparent and interlaced
00484 #       $im->transparent($colors{'white'});
00485         $im->interlaced('true');
00486 
00487         # Put a black frame around the picture
00488         $im->rectangle(0,0,$size[0]-1,$size[1]-1,$colors{'black'});
00489 
00490         # draw functions
00491 
00492             foreach my $f ($self->fn) {
00493             #$self->draw_function($f);
00494             $f->draw($self);  # the graph is passed to the function so that the label can call back as needed.
00495         }
00496        # and fill the regions
00497         foreach my $r ($self->fillRegion) {
00498             my ($x,$y,$color_name) = @{$r};
00499             my $color = ${$self->colors}{$color_name};
00500             $self->im->fill($self->ii($x),$self->jj($y),$color);
00501         }
00502 
00503         #draw hticks
00504         my $tk;
00505         my @ticks = @{$self->{hticks}};
00506         if (@ticks) {
00507             my $nudge = shift(@ticks);
00508             my $j     = $self->jj(shift(@ticks));
00509             my $tk_clr= $self->{'colors'}{shift(@ticks)};
00510 
00511             foreach $tk (@ticks) {
00512                 $tk = $self->ii($tk);
00513                 # print "tk=$tk\n";
00514                 $self->im->line($tk,$j+int($nudge),$tk,$j-int($nudge),$tk_clr);
00515             }
00516         }
00517         #draw vticks
00518         @ticks = @{$self->{vticks}};
00519         if (@ticks) {
00520             my $nudge = shift(@ticks);
00521             my $i     = $self->ii(shift(@ticks));
00522             my $tk_clr= $self->{'colors'}{shift(@ticks)};
00523 
00524             foreach $tk (@ticks) {
00525                 $tk = $self->jj($tk);
00526                 # print "tk=$tk\n";
00527                 $self->im->line($i+int($nudge),$tk,$i-int($nudge),$tk,$tk_clr);
00528             }
00529         }
00530         #draw vgrid
00531 
00532         my @grid = @{$self->{vgrid}};
00533         if (@grid)  {
00534             my $x_value;
00535             my $grid_clr= $self->{'colors'}{shift(@grid)};
00536 
00537             foreach $x_value (@grid) {
00538                 $x_value = $self->ii($x_value); # scale
00539                 #print "grid_line=$grid_line\n";
00540                 $self->im->dashedLine($x_value,0,$x_value,$self->{'size'}[1],$grid_clr);
00541             }
00542         }
00543         #draw hgrid
00544         @grid = @{$self->{hgrid}};
00545         if (@grid) {
00546             my $grid_clr= $self->{'colors'}{shift(@grid)};
00547             my $y_value;
00548             foreach $y_value (@grid) {
00549                 $y_value = $self->jj($y_value);
00550                 #print "y_value=$y_value\n";
00551                 #print "width= $self->{width}\n";
00552                 $self->im->dashedLine(0,$y_value,$self->{'size'}[0],$y_value,$grid_clr);
00553             }
00554         }
00555         # draw axes
00556         if (defined ${$self->{vaxis}}[0]) {
00557             my ($x, $color_name) = @{$self->{vaxis}};
00558             my $color = ${$self->colors}{$color_name};
00559             $self->moveTo($x,$self->ymin);
00560             $self->lineTo($x,$self->ymax,$color);
00561             #print "draw vaxis", @{$self->{vaxis}},"\n";
00562             #$self->im->line(0,0,300,300,$color);
00563         }
00564         if (defined $self->{haxis}[0]) {
00565             my ($y, $color_name) = @{$self->{haxis}};
00566             my $color = ${$self->colors}{$color_name};
00567             $self->moveTo($self->xmin,$y);
00568             $self->lineTo($self->xmax,$y,$color);
00569             #print "draw haxis", @{$self->{haxis}},"\n";
00570         }
00571         # draw functions again
00572 
00573         foreach my $f ($self->fn) {
00574             #$self->draw_function($f);
00575             $f->draw($self);  # the graph is passed to the function so that the label can call back as needed.
00576         }
00577 
00578 
00579         #draw labels
00580         my $lb;
00581         foreach $lb ($self->lb) {
00582             $lb->draw($self);  # the graph is passed to the label so that the label can call back as needed.
00583         }
00584         #draw stamps
00585         my $stamp;
00586         foreach $stamp ($self->stamps) {
00587             $stamp->draw($self); # the graph is passed to the label so that the label can call back as needed.
00588         }
00589         my $out;
00590         if ($WWPlot::use_png) {
00591             $out = $im->png;
00592         } else {
00593             $out = $im->gif;
00594         }
00595         $out;
00596 
00597 }

00601 # sub AUTOLOAD {

00616 ##########################
00617 # Access methods
00618 ##########################
00619 sub ymin {
00620     my $self = shift;
00621     my $type = ref($self) || die "$self is not an object";
